author: irsk
title: Great set and a great movie, skimped on a few spots
review: The movie was great and this set is really good.  My daughter (5) loves it.  I took off a star because of missing tattoos on Maui, Tefiti/Teka could have been done bigger, and the little pirates could have been more built out.  I'd rather have paid more or bought two sets but gotten the additional complexity/playability.  But that's somewhat nitpicking... it's good for the price.  If I could do 4.5 starts I would have.

author: ShawnMarie
title: Great playability, fun to build
review:
Moana is the only Disney movie I've really enjoyed recent and my children and I have seen it many, many times.  They got me this set for Christmas and it was fun to build with many unique pieces.

We like the story so much we sometimes re-enact it with our lego sets with the movie soundtrack playing on my laptop.  For us there is tons of playability here.

Wish there was a Kakamora ship set though and the land of monsters.

author: Odeinoichus
title: You're Welcome!
review:
Set #41150 Moana’s Ocean Voyage: A set from 2017 which is extremely difficult to find, this little gem includes many elements from the hit film Moana, there were two sets made for this film in the Disney Theme and this was the larger and more expensive of the two.

How far will you go with Moana and Maui as you journey across the ocean to restore the Heart of Te Fiti? Will Moana meet Elsa and Anna? Snow White? Cinderella or Jasmine? It’s all up to you when you build and have adventures with this impressive set from LEGO Disney.

Sounds like a good marketing description, doesn’t it? This set is pretty impressive, and this review may contain spoilers for the film, so if you have not yet seen it I would suggest not reading any further. You have been warned.

Packaging

The LEGO Disney Princess line became the LEGO Disney line by the time 2017 came along, so each package now has LEGO Disney prominently at the top. The image on the front showcases the set and all of the models and characters included in the set. The back shows off the set along with animation shots from the actual movie, the sparkly magical pixie dust, or Disney magic sparkles are seen all over the box as well.

The manual for this set is fairly thick and features step-by-step build instructions for each numbered bag in the model. Included in this set is a sticker sheet for added detailing.

Parts

There are a few stand out parts in this set, though not many, as most of the elements are standard for LEGO Disney Princess or Disney, whichever you prefer. There’s a nice printed tile element showing Maui’s constellation in the heavens and a few Kakamora printed Minifigure heads which are pretty cute, but overall as I stated about regular bricks, plant elements, tiles and ship parts. Speaking of which, Moana has a nice large sail piece too.

Mini-Dolls

Maui: This is a first, a Big Fig in a Mini-Doll set. Maui is a solid looking character and with his bulky design this Big Fig body does him justice. He is not as large as he could have been, but he does look great. His hook is also included made out of white elements, it’s enchanted and looks very nice. All of the tattoos are included with printed detailing on his arms and torso.

Moana: I love Moana in this set, she looks great, and is actually a bare footed Disney Princess. Unfortunately the Mini-Doll has sculpted shoes on the feet, it would have been nice if LEGO chose to print toes on her, but for some reason they didn’t, which slightly makes Moana look pretty goofy with plain skin-tone shoes on her feet. She has a flower to put in her hair, a banana to store in her boat and overall really looks good aside from the feet.

Te Fiti: I included this here simply to discuss that the character is included as part of the model of the island which is made during the build. Te Fiti is a named character and included, but her model is a very tiny one and honestly seems to be a bit of a letdown.

Heihei: It’s a chicken, a rooster to be precise. It’s really quite a good new animal piece with some great printing on it to match the character from the film. Great addition to the set.

Kakamora: A pair of printed regular Minifigure heads with additional plant elements attached to the top, the Kakamora are after the Heart of Te Fiti and only Moana can stop them, with the help of Maui. These aren’t really Minifigures or Mini-Dolls, but they are characters included in the set and pretty cleverly made.

The build

Bag #1: Moana and her chicken friend Heihei start working building their ship with this bag. It’s a pretty quick build as it is only half of the ship, one sticker is used for detailing. Nothing much else to discuss, easy to follow along and only one sticker means it won’t take long to finish it.

Bag #2: Maui and the Kakamora team up to build the rest of Moana’s ship, the Kakamora raft and a section of Te Fiti’s island. Each model worked on is a quick and efficiently constructed model, I mean there aren’t really any problems here, also of note there are no other stickers to apply during this build. The sail attaches a certain way, this is the only difficult step in the building process because it will not work if you put it on incorrectly.

Bag #3: This final build finishes off Te Fiti’s island, which is definitely not to scale with the character as seen in the movie. But it does an effective job of bringing the character to life in LEGO form. The trees are fun to build, and the island itself is a real treat, but stickers need to be applied appropriately for Te Fiti’s face. And the other. Return the Heart to Te Fiti and save the Islands.

The completed model

Moana’s Boat: This is a solid model. Really impressive, and really looks like the animation model complete with food storage compartment, Te Fiti’s symbol printed sail. The size may be a bit off, it is hard to find a place for Maui and Moana, but they do both sit on the boat. Or stand as the case is. Most of the details are from stickers.

Kakamora Raft: This thing is tiny, it is nothing like what was in the actual movie. Instead we have a tiny little raft with two Kakamora and a catapult, the catapult lets you launch the Kakamora at Moana’s boat so they can board and steal the Heart.

Te Fiti’s Island: This model is where the last of the play features is located, you get to build Te Fiti and Te Ka together, they sit on a spinning plate. Insert the Heart into a slot on the Island and you can change Te Ka restoring her to her true form of Te Fiti. It’s a very impressive little model, but the key word here is little, Te Fiti and Te Ka were massive. A slightly larger model may have worked batter, or at least a taller model so she is taller than the trees on the island.

Overall opinion

Moana is a very enjoyable film, I really enjoyed it when I first saw it and really liked how LEGO introduced it into the Disney Princess line. This set is a bit everywhere, it features a lot of elements from the story of the film, but feels slightly disjointed. Te Fiti is somewhat tiny, the Kakamora ship is way too small which means the adventure aspect of the story is not captured as well as it could have been. It is a nice set though and I would recommend it, if you can still find it anywhere. It is surprisingly quick for Disney sets to vanish from Retail, even before they Retire. Recommended.

author: Oregondete81
title: Moana's Ocean Voyage-Buy this set if you love the Moana movie!
review:
Item:

-This is “Moana’s Ocean Voyage” set, one of two sets from the Disney film Moana. The set is 307 Pcs and depicts Moana’s boat, Tefiti’s island, miniature coconut pirate ship, and 2 minfigs (Moana & Maui).

Why I bought this set:

-My Fiancé recently had me watch Moana, one of her favorite Disney movies, and it instantly became one of my favorite Disney movies too. It was a fantastic film and when I saw this lego set it was instantly one I wanted as a fan. I tend to focus on Creator and Marvel sets, but this is one of the best sets I’ve seen Lego put out and I decided to venture into the Disney Princess line and get this set as a gift for my fiancé…hoping I can pull her into my LEGO fandom as well ;-)

Pros:

-The minifigs are great! I think the Moana representation is good and the Maui representation is exceptional.

-If you count the rooster as Hei Hei and the coconuts as Pirates you could technically count this set as coming with 5 characters from the film.

-The build is fairly simple and easy with the exception of Te Fiti, which requires a bit of attention, especially with the stickers.

-This set stays true to the movie and includes a lot of important plot representations. Her boat is integral to her travel and well represented, the coconut pirates are iconic and represented, and Te Fitis transformation is such a neat element in a small set like this. I think this set is much better than the other(41149) in representing the story elements of the movie.

-The coconut pirates, changing Te-Fiti set-up, and the boat make me think kids would have a lot of fun reenacting scenes from the movie.

-This set has a lot of detail and character. The boat is about 8”(20cm) and with the sail can really grab attention on display. It’s a beautiful set for display.

-This set has a lot of great pieces for anyone looking to do ship MOC’s.

Cons:

-I like the Moana minifig overall, but because it is the Friends version the wrists don't articulate so when you put things in her hands they can only be oriented vertically. Not a huge deal, but the pose-ability is limited.

-Maui’s hook is not a great representation. I think Lego could have done better by creating a custom piece for the hook instead of using a brick built version.

-The Te Fiti stickers could have been a little bit better representations. The Green one looks a bit off from the movie character, the face depicted looks sad instead of happy and loving like the movie version. 

-I love the addition of the coconut pirates, but I wish they had done a bit more with their ship. The ship from the movie is so awesome and lent itself to an epic LEGO build, so to get this tiny little raft was a bit disappointing. I would have gladly paid $5-10 more for this set if they had included a more creative coconut pirate ship.

Overall Impression:

-This is an amazing set overall. I love the minifigs and doing the set build with my fiancé was an awesome experience. I would absolutely recommend this set to any fans of the Moana movie and any parents looking for a LEGO set from a movie they know their kids like. If your kids like Moana, they will love this LEGO set. I would also recommend this set to any collectors looking for a great Disney set.
